snippet: The Ravens’ Ray Lewis has not spoken much about his involvement in two men’s deaths, but he has advised young players, “Don’t ever take my path.”
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column recounts personal travails of Baltimore Ravens linebacker Ray Lewis, who was implicated in a 2000 fight that claimed the lives of two young men, as he prepares with team for upcoming playoff game against Denver Broncos; holds Lewis' career, whether or not he acknowledges it, has been a testament to redemption and atonement, to making the most of a second opportunity.
lead_paragraph: The Ravens’ Ray Lewis has not spoken much about his involvement in two men’s deaths, but he has advised young players, “Don’t ever take my path.”

headline.seo: Ray Lewis Holds Tight to Faith and a Second Chance
headline.main: A Sinner Holds Tight to Faith and a Second Chance
headline.print_headline: A Sinner Holds Tight to Faith and a Second Chance
